instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2936: What is 820-2936? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, Audio Jack not working
threads.message:
Working on an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with a bad audio jack. Headphones are detected when plugged in, but no sound/audio at all. Speakers work normally. Replaced the jack since they seem to die on this model, and same issue. Checked all resistors and filters on the circuit, and they all seem to read fine. I have 3.3v on pin 8 of J6700.

Really at a loss here; any ideas of what I need to check next? Any help or direction appreciated.

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, Audio Jack not working
[SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, Audio Jack not working
threads.message:
You nailed it, Duke, thanks. I feel pretty stupid not thinking to check that one, but didn't want to brute-force it just yet (and replace the 3-5 ICs/components in the circuit). You can mark this one solved! For once it wasn't the jack.

Thanks!
